docs.lead_paragraph: Novartis A.G. of Switzerland said yesterday that it would offer cards to low-income elderly Americans to provide discounts of 25 percent or more on the company's brand-name drugs. Novartis said the discounts would take effect in January. Those eligible will be people who are 65 or older and have incomes of $26,000 or less for single people and $35,000 for couples.

headline.main: Novartis Plans Drug Discount For Elderly

docs.abstract: Novartis AG, Swiss drug manufacturer, will offer cards to low-income elderly Americans to provide discounts of 25 percent or more, beginning in January 2002, on company's brand-name drugs; those eligible would be people 65 or older, with incomes of $26,000 or less for single people and $35,000 for couples (M)
